headline: Pasta e Fagioli (Pasta and Beans)
description: Pasta fagioli is a traditional Italian soup with pasta and cannellini beans in a tomato broth. Serve with garlic bread for a hearty, comforting meal.

video.name: How to Make Pasta e Fagioli (Pasta and Beans)

name: Pasta e Fagioli (Pasta and Beans)
recipeIngredient: 0.5 cup ditalini or other small pasta
1 (15 ounce) can cannellini beans, with liquid

recipeInstructions.text: Heat olive oil in a large saucepan over medium heat. Add onion, celery, garlic, parsley, Italian seasoning, pepper flakes, and salt; cook and stir until onion is translucent, about 5 minutes. Stir in chicken broth, tomato sauce, and tomatoes. Reduce the heat to low and simmer for 15 to 20 minutes.
Add pasta and cook until tender, about 10 minutes.
Stir in undrained beans and cook until heated through, 3 to 4 minutes.

review.reviewBody: I added a second can of beans, drained, and poured it over rice since I didn't have any pasta on hand.
It makes a pleasant easy meal . The flavors in this are really delicious. Didn't change anything. The fresh tomatoes give a nice flavor.

Best and easiest recipe. Changes: Used 24oz boxed Tuscan style chicken broth, substituted 16.5oz petite chopped tomatoes instead of peeled ones and had Ditalini pasta on hand. It's like Mama always made.

It was just ok. I like adding the beans to the veggie simmer and letting them pick up flavor from the veggies (and the spices and herbs) as they break down during the simmer. I use the Pressure Cooker to hurry this up quite a bit. I find that 10 minutes of High Pressure and then 20 more minutes of natural release, can give you a great stew viscosity, with many of the beans naturally mashed into the stew! This step will save you 2 hours of slow simmering on the stovetop. I wait to add the pasta, and I pre-boil the pasta in chicken stock and the brine from the can of beans (BTW, Goya's black beans also work great in this recipe), and then I add the pasta to the veggie and bean stew to finish cooking in the stew. Thanks for sharing this version of this ultra popular recipe with us! Happy New Year!

Delicious. I've made several versions, this is right in the pack of one of my favorite meals. One suggestion: PLEASE try ditalini as the pasta, it is the exact right size and shape for this dish, and is small enough not to splash if one or two fall off the spoon. Your shirt might thank you.
Please don't waste your time blanching and chopping tomatoes. A 14 oz. can of petite diced tomatoes works just as well and makes things a lot easier.
This was amazing. My husband loved it as well. I used canned diced tomatoes and eliminated the celery. This recipe goes in the regular rotation.
This is definitely not Pasta Fagioli, which has meat in it, is stew like in consistency and lots of aromatics. Also the traditional pasta for this dish is ditalini. This is more a minestrone recipe.
Just an okay soup recipe, altho, it is easy & comes together quickly. However, it is NOT Pasta e Fagioli, & should not be misconstrued as such.

I love this soup! I always double the recipie. I add a little chopped sausage or ground turkey and minced carrots, peppers to step 1. I use a little less pasta and more veggies than the recipe calls for. I add baby spinach at the end. I've had to use different beans when out of cannellini beans, and it doesn't matter, this is such a delicious soup! One of my favorite!
love it! added extra broth to make more soupy, and served with garlic bread (store bought or homemade)

I made this and loved it. Very simple. Next time I will double the recipe. I made some changes because I didn't have everything on the list. I used veggie stock i/o chicken, I double the liquid due to comments I read, I used ditallinni pasta. I used 3 tablespoons of tomato paste i/o of 8 oz of sauce. At the end I also added spinach to add some nutrition and also use up some spinach I had in the fridge. It all turned out great.

Loved it! Use full container chicken broth or veggie broth, 2 cans diced Italian tomatoes, cook in instapot. Used cheese filled tortellini- boil it first. Place in bowls and pour soup over top. Serve with crusty warm bread!
Great soup. I used red kidney beans and a can of diced tomatoes. Everyone..including the kids...loved it.

Delicious! Next time I will use ditalini. I did add some frozen spinach. I defrosted the package, squeezed out the excess water and only added a small amount of spinach. The spinach added a nice color and flavor to the soup. Also, if you don't like spicy, do not add the crushed red pepper. This recipe is a keeper!
Easy peasant dish. I might add some sausage to it next time. Or pancetta.
My family thought the soup was excellent. Even my 4 year old granddaughter thought it was good. I would definitely make it again.
Soup was wonderful and my wife loved it so much she finished for lunch the day not leaving any for me. Well I guess I have to make another pot.

Never heard of this but sounded good and made it. Omg fantastic. Must have read at least 100 reviews. Didn't have spinach pasta but added well drained frozen spinach . Wonderful healthy soup. Did add an extra can of broth and used ditala pasta. A keeper.
Best Pasta Fagioli ever. Very simple to make in a short amount of time
This is a good tasting simple recipe. I used canned tomatoes to make things easier and I used some hot sauce instead of red pepper flakes. I would make it again
Great recipe, my family really enjoyed the soup; I added parmesan and smoked gouda cheese to mine and it was absolutely amazing. thanks for the recipe, this is now one of my family's favorite soups

Being in the mood for pasta, but not wanting a bunch of gooey cheese, I made this for supper tonight. We both really liked it, even my meat lover hubby. I used my food processor to chop all the veggies which was a HUGE timesaver plus it gave it something other than a "stew" look. Kind of classy I thought. Other than that, I don't have much different than the other commitments. Very nutritious and delicious. Will make again.
My family really enjoyed this recipe made minor changes but still cane out delicious!!
Used canned diced tomatoes instead and vegetable broth.

First time making Pasta Fagioli...Superb. I was impressed with the ease and result of this wonderful soup. It surely is a keeper. I did double the recipe to freeze. and am thankful for the reviewers who mentioned added pasta last to the mix. Look forward to defrosting eating when the weather is cooler. Thanks for a great recipe.

I just made this and if not for the method, this would have got 5 stars from me hands down. The saute time takes 10 minutes not 5. Simmering took 40 for the celery to be tender enough. The only changes I made was using Vegetable broth because my daughter is Vegetarian, and I used small shell pasta. Everything else was exactly as written. This soup is amazing. So easy to make and so full of flavor. If you don't like your foods too spicy, cut down on the red pepper, It was perfect for us as is. We liked the spice. I am going to make double batches of this next time, so I can freeze some. If you do freeze, don't add the pasta. Add that after you thaw and reheat. 
Final rating: Method 4 stars, Flavor 5+ stars

I had been searching for a recipe that resembled the one I loved in Rome. This is the one. The only change I made was putting 1/2 the recommended amount of red pepper in the recipe, after reading that the 1/4 tsp. was rather spicy, and the result was perfect for my family. Our 1, 3, and 7-year-olds finished their servings and asked for more. This recipe is a keeper!
Excellent taste and so easy to make.
Everyone loved it!
I did not change. It was great
Easy recipe and so very delicious! I doubled the recipe and there was hardly a scrap left. I substituted a can of diced tomatoes for the fresh tomatoes.
This recipe was easy and delicious. I used can Italian tomatoes and also added meatballs only because my family has to have meat for dinner. Delicious and will definitely make this again.
My daughter loved it! Came out great.
Hearty, healthy soup. Easy to make and tastes so good! Family ate every last drop. Will definitely make it again.
I cut the amount of pasta in half. I like to have more sauce to dip my bread into
This was easy and delicious! I added spinach as someone else suggested, and it was a good addition. A warm, comforting meal for winter- definitely recommend.
I added ground beef, either way it's awesome.
I used crushed tomato, tomato paste and ditalini pasta, I also added carrots and used turkey sausage instead of ground beef.
Made as written. Really good and easy to make.

This was a wonderful recipe. I made this with dry Cannellini beans (not canned) and added a little fresh spinach to the soup at the end. It all amounted to a soup that will certainly grace our dinner table for many Fall and Winter seasons to come. Served with a homemade French Baguette made the meal savory and satisfying. We also cook the pasta separately, adding some to the bowl and ladling the soup over it to keep the pasta from absorbing too much liquid and retaining its al dente texture.
I've already made this three times! It was AMAZING! The whole family enjoyed it, even my picky seven-year-old.
Delish with the spinach pasta. Has the perfect set of flavors blended.

Fiancé and I really enjoyed this tasty and filling soup. I made a few modifications, but nothing that inherently changed the original recipe. I added some carrot because I had some to use up. As a result, I increased the amount of chicken broth to just over 2 cups to make up for the added vegetable. Also, subbed fresh parsley for the dried because I have a bunch from my garden and used ditallini pasta as I didn't have spinach pasta. Very good and I'll make it again!

A hearty filling soup that's quick and easy to make. I was out of cannellini beans, so I substituted chick peas, which I actually like a lot more. Many different pastas are appropriate; I used elbows or mini farfalle that I had in the pantry. Also substituted a 14.5 oz. can of petite diced tomatoes for the fresh tomatoes; quicker, easier, and again, keep them in your pantry for use anytime. This is a great winter time meal to make on a snow day for lunch or dinner.
Really enjoyed this recipe, it is one I will be making again soon.

So I made the recipe a with a few changes. I used crushed tomatoes and only used 1 cup of chicken broth. I also just used regular pasta noodles and half cooked them before adding them. But it was excellent! My fiancé and I loved it! I didn’t have any Italian seasoning either so I just threw in half a teaspoon basil, half a teaspoon oregano, a pinch of onion powder and a teaspoon of garlic powder
Added more broth.

We loved this recipe!! My husband asked for it again, so I obliged him. I added a can of tomatoes, okra and corn for a little change. It's simmering, I'm waiting. Salad and cornbread!!! Very good anything canned was low sodium as well as the stock.
Easy to prepare and very delicious!!

My husband loves soups. He also especially loves Pasta Fagiloi. I found this a couple years ago and ever since then this is his absolute favorite and says it’s the best he’s ever had. We live in New Jersey, the land of Italian food. That’s a big statement here!
Easy to make, great flavor. Will definitely be making it again.
really good! the only thing I changed was I used a can of diced tomatoes rather than fresh chopped tomatoes. my husband is a vegan so I was happy to find a delicious recipe with no meat / dairy.
I will make this again. My family liked it!

Good soup. I doubled the pasta and omitted the beans because my kids don't Ike them. I added the pasta a few minutes sooner than called for after reading several reviews. The soup smelled wonderful while cooking and tasted good.
Easy recipe. Leftovers taste great. I added chopped ground beef and sweet Italian sausage I had in the frig which gave the meal added flavor without adding effort.
My husband loves this recipe.
Good! I had to sub Great Northern beans. Will make again!

My nonna Giulia, rest her soul,made a similar Pasta eFagioli (pasta and bean soup), although her version called for a small bulb of fennel...no celery. Slice and fry the fennel in butter before adding it to the broth. Delicious.

This is sooo good, only difference is I didn't add fresh tomatoes, and I only had rotel on hand (canned tomatoes and chiles), and then I added mozzarella and Parmesan afterwards. It's really good, the cheese gave it a more creamy color which I think is more aesthetically appealing.
I used chicken broth instead of tomato sauce everyone loved it

My family loved this soup! I doubled the broth and cut the red pepper flakes in half because my littles are wimpy when it comes to spice. I also used ditalini noodles and a can of diced tomatoes instead of fresh tomatoes because I'm lazy like that. Super yummy!!
Loved, loved, loved this recipe! We made the recipe as written except for some added seasoned turkey as a protein. Served with a salad and crusty baguette, it is a perfect dinner.
I used fresh spinach and garbanzo beans since I had no spinach pasta or cannelini beans. It was delicious!

I used the recipe as a base. I added chicken broth as suggested and Italian sausage and omitted the celery as my family is not a big fan. I did add celery seasoning. My family really liked the dish and I will definitely make it again!
loved it!
Great recipe. I added extra red pepper flakes and garlic along with Italian sausage. This one is definitely a keeper.
Recipe was easy to follow and easy to make. Soup was delicious and will definitely make it again. Try it tonight.

I made this recipe recently and substituted the 2 tomatoes with a can of stewed tomatoes and it was still very bland. I added more of all of the seasoning and garlic and that helped a lot. If you make this as written, be prepared for it to have little flavor.
This recipe wasn't very flavorful to me. I added more salt, garlic powder, and italian seasoning to enhance the flavor. It was okay, but I won't make this recipe again
added Kale
good! ingredients neglect to tell you that pasta is needed so don't go by the list it has here
Very easy to make, healthy and lots of flavor. Will definitely make this again.

Huge hit tonight! Made a few changes: used 1 whole cup of pasta, 32 oz of chicken broth, can of diced tomatoes instead of chopping tomatoes, and did drain beans. Amount of spice was perfect with the additional broth. I will be making this again....it was husband & kid approved!
This is a really good pasta dish.
I added more pasta and I think next time I will add some turkey ground beef for more protein. Great recipe for sure!

A delicious meal for two! I added 1 cup more chicken stock and doubled the pasta. I also used canned diced tomatoes...other than that, followed the recipe. We really liked the spicy tang, too. It wasn't too much...just right. We enjoyed it thoroughly and had plenty left over for another meal.

We have made this many times and love it! Changes I made: substitute ditalini pasta for spinach pasta, also add 1 tsp of basil. Suggest adding more chicken broth than the recipe calls for, otherwise the resulting soup is pretty thick.
This soup was so good. I added chicken and carrots because hubby has to have meat with his meal. If you did not add the chicken it will still be good.. Delicious !
This is a great, super hearty dish. It is not so good for leftovers, though, so make sure your family eats it all up the day it's made.

I'd say 4.5 stars because I didn't have all the ingredients, so had to adjust. I didn't have tomato sauce, and I used my canned tomatoes rather than fresh. I will definitely make it again, I took it to work for a carry-in and it was all gone by the end of the day. Thanks for sharing.
Great flavor doubled the tomatoe sauce, stock, beans and pasta to make more and used carrots instead of celery since that's all I had on hand. For once my picky kids ate everything!!
Recipe is perfect as is!!
It' delicious!

I loved this soup! It was very flavorful and quite healthy! The only changes I made was to add 1/8 cup fresh basil, sub 1 14.5 oz can of petite diced tomatoes instead of fresh tomatoes because I didn't have any, used a 14.5 oz can of tomato sauce instead of the 8 oz can and added 1/2 can of water since I like my soup not quite as thick. My family loved it, just the right amount of spice, even for my 14 month old granddaughter!
Great and easy recipe I used Kale insead of spinach .... yum!

I made a few minor adjustments such as vegetable stock instead of chicken as a personal preference. I also used fresh tomatoes instead of stewed and peeled and added some zucchini and green bell peppers. I also prefer to rinse the beans since the liquid tends to be thick and gooey. This is an excellent one pan meal!
For myself, there is too much celery and hot pepper flakes. Any type of small pasta can be used instead of spinach pasta.
This is a great recipe! My man and family loved it!
Love this!!!!

This was superb, easy and filling without being heavy. I used elbow macaroni and for half of the beans I had to substitute white hominy because I didn't have enough cannellini beans. The second time I substituted all canned diced tomatoes and twice as much red pepper flakes. Perfect
Made this tonight and my family loved it.
I added ground beef and kale to it

My wife and I loved this recipe. It was the best pasta fagioli soup we ever had and we both come from Italian American backgrounds.
I doubled the recipe with the exception of the onion and made plastic containers filled with it and froze it. It freezes well with Ditalini (didnt use spinach pasta and used 3 stalks of celery) in it too, this way we just "grab and go" and take a container to work for lunch! Made 8 plastic containers for the freezer.
Thank you Star Pooley for a great recipe!
Easy to make, very filling and delicious! I added carrots and pre-cooked kale.

We really loved this as a family. Great taste and texture. The only changes I made was vegetable broth (to make it vegetarian) and I didn't have spinach pasta so used plain. It still came out fantastic, and the leftovers reheat well so I had a bonus for lunch! I think that next time I will take the suggestion of adding some spinach to the soup, as that sounds tasty.
Instead of using fresh tomatoes. I used hunts diced with Italian seasoning. Turned out really delicious!

It's really tasty. Next time I will leave out the red pepper flakes though :) too spicy. Also next time I will dilute with water or more chicken stock, since mine ended up being more of a pasta dish than a soup after the liquid mysteriously vanished.. But still I won't take away any stars because it was delicious!
I give this one a 5 because I think its awesome (oldest daughter would probably give it a 3 and youngest a 2). I think it is tasty and nutritious.
